channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Category of a map and nonlinear analysis
item.description: arXiv:2403.18848v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A classic problem in analysis is to solve nonlinear equations of the form \begin{equation*} F(x)=0, \end{equation*} where $F:D^n\to \mathbb{R}^m$ is a continuous map of the closed unit disk $D^n\subset\mathbb{R}^n$ in $\mathbb{R}^m$. A topological technique, which exists in the literature, for the existence of solutions of nonlinear equations is the topological degree theory. In this work, we will use the category of a map theory to solve the problem of existence of solutions of nonlinear equations. This theory, as we will show in this work, provides an alternative topological technique to study nonlinear equations.
item.dc:creator: Cesar A. Ipanaque Zapata

item.title: Universal Coverings for Limit and Pseudotopological Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2403.18852v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Limit and Pseudotopological spaces are two generalizations of topological spaces which are defined by indicating what filters converge under some axioms. In this article, we introduce covering spaces and set forth some necessary conditions for a construction for a universal covering space.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Trevi\~no-Marroqu\'in

item.title: Mappings contracting triangles
item.description: arXiv:2403.19488v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The aim of the current paper is to introduce a new class of contractive mappings, which are contracting (a feature of) triangles. We prove that maps contracting triangles are continuous and give the fixed point result for such mappings. We emphasize that our main theorem encompasses many functions, with significant applicability, for which the result holds, thereby representing a notable advancement in this research domain.
item.dc:creator: Ovidiu Popescu, Cristina Maria Pacurar
